title: Abdel Fattah al-Burhan - Wikipedia
snippet: He is leading the SAF against the Rapid Support Forces (RSF) in the ongoing Sudanese civil war. Al-Burhan survived an assassination attempt in July 2024. Abdel Fattah al-Burhan was born in 1960 in the village of Gandatu in northern Sudan, to a Sufi Ja'ali family.

title: Abdel Fattah al-Burhan | Sudanese politician | Britannica
snippet: Other articles where Abdel Fattah al-Burhan is discussed: Sudan: Transition: Abdel Fattah al-Burhan, who had been leading the military-led transition council, was named president.

title: How the Conflict in Sudan Became a Humanitarian Catastrophe | The New Yorker
snippet: In 2021, Sudan’s military, in coördination with a paramilitary group called the Rapid Support Forces (R.S.F.), launched a coup. But the alliance between the Sudanese Armed Forces (SAF), led by Abdel Fattah al-Burhan, and the R.S.F., led by Mohamed Hamdan Dagalo, known as Hemedti, quickly crumbled, and by April of 2023, the two sides were openly at war.

title: Abdel Fattah al-Burhan (1960- ) | BlackPast.org
snippet: Abdel Fattah al-Burhan, the current ruler of Sudan, was born on July 11, 1960, in Gandatu, Sudan. He was educated in local schools and joined the military as a young man. He rose through the ranks and in the early 2000s he was posted in the ...

title: Israel, a behind-the-scenes powerbroker in Sudan | Responsible Statecraft
snippet: In 2020, as part of a deal in which the Trump Administration removed Sudan’s designation as a state sponsor of terrorism, Sudan agreed to join the Abraham Accords. General Abdel Fattah al Burhan, head of Sudan’s sovereignty council and de facto head of state,
